name: BBCWorld
text:

name: BBCWorld
text:
False or misleading posts about #Election2020 are going viral

Some, amplified by Donald Trump, call into question the integrity of the vote as some key states lean towards Biden

#BBCRealityCheck challenges some of the claims

[Thread] 

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/lV8HktMHLY

name: BBCWorld
text:
Misleading Claim: A voting map in Michigan showing a sudden increase of around 130,000 votes for Biden, but none for Trump has gone viral on social media

President Trump has tweeted the image, which is raising speculation about voter fraud

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/Y85QV7liCo

name: BBCWorld
text:
Reality: It was a simple data entry error that was later corrected

Decision Desk, the website which created the map, said: "It was a simple error from a file... that we ingested‚Ä¶ the state noticed the error and produced an updated count"

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/ry7ojgQzne

name: BBCWorld
text:
Misleading Claim: More people in Wisconsin voted than were registered

Tweet: "Wisconsin has more votes than people who are registered to vote...number of registered voters: 3,129,000... number of votes cast: 3,239,920. This is direct evidence of fraud"

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/kI3g5PLA8x

name: BBCWorld
text:
Reality: This number of registered voters is outdated - the latest figure as of 1 November is 3,684,726

The state also allows people to register to vote on election day, so the number of registered voters could be even higher than the reported figure

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/QjkYPRjksy

name: BBCWorld
text:
False Claim: Votes written in Sharpie won't be counted

In a video, a woman describes how voting machines can't read ballots marked with Sharpies

This led to claims of voter fraud and that large numbers of votes from Trump supporters were invalidated

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/VdQCj0Z0O7

name: BBCWorld
text:
Reality: Officials say Sharpies do not invalidate ballots

Arizona secretary of state, Katie Hobbs says they'll be counted: "even if the machines can't read them...we have ways to count them. They're going to be counted."

https://t.co/wiDP3IupnD https://t.co/7Nw73ybg6T

name: BBCWorld
text: For accurate reporting and results on #Election2020 click here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/fVQ13KG8wT https://t.co/2hsbnoAart

name: BBCWorld
text:
False or misleading posts about #Election2020 are being shared on social media

#BBCRealityCheck fact-check three viral claims https://t.co/G65XyaaKK7

name: BBCWorld
BBCWorld
text:
President Trump made a series of unsubstantiated claims about attempts to ‚Äúrig‚Äù the election

#BBCRealityCheck has fact checked his speech

[Thread]

https://t.co/HNrUI4y2N1

name: BBCWorld
text:
He falsely claimed that counting had stopped at one location in Georgia because a water pipe burst ‚Äúfar away‚Äù

The burst pipe did actually affect a room where votes were being counted

https://t.co/HNrUI4y2N1

name: BBCWorld
text:
He spoke of ‚Äúillegal votes‚Äù and said ‚Äúif you count the votes that came in late, we‚Äôre looking at them very strongly‚Äù 

But late postal votes can be legally counted in about half of US states ‚Äì so long as they‚Äôre postmarked by 3 Nov

https://t.co/HNrUI4y2N1

name: BBCWorld
text:
He described postal voting as a ‚Äúcorrupt system"

But there is no evidence that the system is corrupt and electoral fraud in the US is very rare

https://t.co/7UHHZ9Pbpv

name: BBCWorld
text:
He said at one count in Detroit, the windows were covered to ‚Äúblock the counting area‚Äù from poll watchers

The windows were covered to stop people outside filming workers but there were hundreds of poll watchers inside ‚Äì from both parties

 https://t.co/HNrUI4y2N1

name: BBCWorld
text: Read the full #BBCRealityCheck analysis:  https://t.co/HNrUI4y2N1
